title: hompage
snippet: Hello and welcome to my hompage!In this article I will show you how I build it and how you can do it to!Keep in mind, was not my idea it was thanks to Techno Tim.We will use the jekyll-theme-chirpy: GithubBefore we BeginnInstall Dependencies (Ruby, RubyGems, Jekyll, Bundle, Git):for Fedora:sudo dnf install ruby rubygems ruby-devel gcc gcc-c++ rpm-buildor for Arch:sudo pacman -S ruby ruby-rdoc gcc makethen:sudo gem install jekyll bundlerStep 1Create a Github Repository with the Chripy Starter and if you want to host your site on Github(I recommend it) name it &lt;GH_USERNAME&gt;.github.io, where GH_USERNAME represents your GitHub username.Step 2Clone your Repo and go to the root of it and install the missing dependencies:bundleStep3Running a local server:bundle exec jekyll sOr for Docker:docker run -it --rm \ --volume="$PWD:/srv/jekyll" \ -p 4000:4000 jekyll/jekyll \ jekyll serveAfter a while, navigate to the site at http://localhost:4000.Now you can customize your site as you want.HostingOn Github Pages:FirstMake sure your Repo is set to publicSecondCommit your edited Repo to GithubLastGo to the Settings of your Repository and navigate to Pages, change the Source to gh-pages and you are done!You can visit your site at &lt;GH_USERNAME&gt;.github.io.
